line: Dolphins sleep with one eye open
Vacuum cleaners were originally horse-drawn
The largest padlock in the world weighs 916 pounds(415kg)
For 20 years, a cat served as mayor of an Alaskan town
Squirrels are behind most power outages in the U.S
Spider webs were used as bandages in ancient times
Cotton candy was invented by a dentist
Someone tried to sell New Zealand on eBay
The electric chair was invented by a dentist
Bubble wrap was originally intended to be wallpaper
The first-ever documented feature film was made in Australia in 1906
Apples, peaches, and raspberries are all members of the rose family
Canada eats more macaroni and cheese than any other nation in the world
An animal’s yawn based on how large their brain is. The bigger the brain, the longer they will yawn
Surgeons who play video games at least 3 hours a week perform 27% faster and make 37% fewer errors
A strawberry is not an actual berry, but a banana is
It snowed in the Sahara desert for 30 minutes on February 18, 1979
Cookie Monster’s real name is Sid
Lettuce is a member of the sunflower family
Using a hands-free device to talk on the phone while driving is shown to be equally or more dangerous than driving drunk
Jellyfish are considered biologically immortal. They don’t age and will never die unless they are killed
The collective name for a group of unicorns is called a blessing
Crows can remember the faces of individual humans. They can also hold a grudge.
“She sells seashells by the seashore” was written about a female paleontologist from the 1800s. She actually sold dinosaur bones and fossilized shells
Another term for your nieces or nephews would be “niblings”
Selfies now cause more deaths than shark attacks
Dogs can be allergic to humans
The longest one-syllable word is “screeched.”
The original recipe for chocolate contained chili powder instead of sugar
The T-rex’s closest living relative is the chicken
Half of all bank robberies take place on a Friday
In Utah, it is illegal to swear in front of a dead person
A snail can have 25,000 teeth
When the moon is directly overhead, you will weigh slightly less.
The “sixth sick sheik's sixth sheep's sick” is said to be the toughest tongue twister in the English language
On average, people fear spiders more than they do death.
Donkey Kong got his name because his creator believed “donkey” meant “stupid” in English and wanted to convey the impression that the character was a “Stupid Ape.”
People can have a psychological disorder called Boanthropy that makes them believe that they are a cow. They try to live their life as a cow.
The name for the shape of Pringles is called a “Hyperbolic Paraboloid.”
A duel between three people is actually called a truel.
The stage before frostbite is called “frostnip.”
In South Korea, there is an emergency number (113) to report spies.
Japan is facing a ninja shortage. There is a high demand for “ninja shows”, but it is a dying tradition, and companies have trouble finding properly trained ninjas.
The first roller coaster was used to transport coal down a hill. After people found that it could reach speeds up to 50 miles per hour, tourists asked to ride on it for a few cents.
Eight of the ten largest statues in the world are of Buddhas.
It took the creator of the Rubik’s Cube, Erno Rubik, one month to solve the cube after creating it; as of June 2018, the world record is 4.22 seconds.
In Morse Code -.- means k.
Boeing uses potatoes to test their in-flight Wi-Fi, as they reflect and absorb the signals similarly to people. The project is called Synthetic Personnel Using Dialectic Substitution- or SPUDS.
There’s a flower that smells like chocolate! Native to Mexico, this dark red flower is not edible. It is called “cosmos atrosanguineus” or “chocolate cosmos.”
In 2014, a missing woman on vacation in Iceland was found when it was discovered that she was in the search party looking for herself.
Tyromancy is the practice of predicting the future with cheese.
Shoe shops used X-Ray machines to measure shoe sizes in the 1940s before the risks of X-Rays were fully understood.
Canadians say “sorry” so much that a law was passed in 2009 declaring that an apology can’t be used as evidence of admission to guilt.
A single strand of Spaghetti is called a “Spaghetto”.
Fruit stickers are edible, though the same as any fruit, washing prior to eating is recommended. The glue used for them is regulated by the FDA.
Although GPS is free for the world to use, it costs $2 million per day to operate. The money comes from American tax revenue.
When Shakira was in second grade, she was rejected by the school choir because her vibrato was too strong. The music teacher told her that she sounded like a goat.
Gaming-related accidents increased by 26.5% during the first 5 months of Pokémon Go being released. This included 2 deaths and $25.5 million in damages.
The word “velociraptor” comes from the Latin words “velox” which means swift, and “raptor” which means robber. Literally – speedy robber!
Tiali is a dingus
There is an insurance policy issued against alien abduction. Around 50,000 policies have been sold, mainly to residents of the U.S. and England.
Somebody hid an episode of South Park inside Tiger Woods 99 as an Easter egg, causing EA to do a massive recall.
One horse can have approximately 15 horsepower. Horsepower is about 746 watts. The term was coined in the late 18th Century.
A man named Ronald MacDonald robbed a Wendy’s in 2005.
Roughly 33% of cats are not affected by catnip. The euphoric reaction commonly associated with catnip is hereditary.
Elephants think people are cute, the same way people think puppies or kittens are cute.
